title: WCAS HISTORY 300-0-22 New Lectures in History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course examines how and why the dynamic, all-embracing and sometimes destructive socioeconomic forces of capitalism reordered Europe and the world, integrating different regions of the globe in surprising new ways, culminating in the unprecedented period of economic expansion and social change often called the Industrial Revolution.

Historical questions to be considered include the ultimate sources of wealth, the causes of economic growth, the formation of social classes, the cultural consequences of market relations, and the differential impact of the expansion of capitalism throughout the world.
